body:

https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/4568/
It worked. So: LGTM
By the way, I reverted the change. Should I update https://builds.apache.org/view/Beam/job/beam_PostCommit_RunnableOnService_SparkLocal/ ?

Let's try to initiate this ROS build manually once after the merge, and assuming it works (should be similar to what we've just tested successfully) we can enable it tow run on PostCommit automatically.
It makes sense.

Not sure if [this](https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/4569/) "backend error" is something related to this change.
R: @tgroh
Replied on dev. This is WAI, in fact one of the reasons for the transform existing and having any logic. What trouble did you run into?

JB: you didn't run ROS, you ran the precommit tests manually. This is not what is broken, not what we're trying to fix :). This change did not actually fix the build, so should not have been merged. https://builds.apache.org/view/Beam/job/beam_PostCommit_RunnableOnService_SparkLocal/32/testReport/

`ReduceFnRunner` is the shared `runner-core` abstraction for executing (in the most general case) a `GroupAlsoByWindow`. We currently invoke the `ReduceFnRunner` via the `GroupAlsoByWindowViaWindowSetDoFn`; however, that isn't really a `DoFn`, as it requires direct access to `StateInternals`, `TimerInternals`, and `WindowingInternals` - this PR merely moves the behavior of `GroupAlsoByWindowViaWindowSetDoFn` into the `GroupAlsoByWindowsEvaluator` to enable removal of `OldDoFn`

Lines 168-187 are the "shared code" - the rest is just scaffolding and runner-specific concerns
R: @lukecwik
R: @kennknowles

@SGA-yamashita-kensaku That's a great question.  I'm not sure how quickly the Python SDK gets new additions ported from the Java SDK.  All I can suggest is searching through the apache-beam Jira issues.  If I have time, I'll take a look at the current state of the Python SDK I/O package and modules and give you some more useful feedback...
R: @davorbonaci
LGTM. Waiting for tests.

+1 to the idea of basically inlining this. I like the idea of having something high level in `runners-core` but there is so little here that I'm not sure what would be factored out. In fact, use of `GroupAlsoByWindowsViaWindowSetDoFn` forces a particular materialization of timers, while each runner might just like to use their own representation.

To be clear, you've also reproduced the late data dropping, which might be nice to have a way to re-use.

And it can be further shrunk (not needed for this PR). `ReduceFnRunner.onTimer(TimerData)` actually doesn't need the timer data, it just needs to fire EOW panes, fire trigger panes, and GC. The `TimerData` is just a hint about which windows to process.
Oops, forgot to checkstyle. Stay tuned.

I changed the Jenkins build with the profiles and add the integration-test goal. Do I have other change to do ?

By the way guys, I added you both as Jenkins job admin.
Merging with HEAD of `python-sdk` branch fixed issue running jobs on Dataflow. @robertwb can you take a look and merge if appropriate? : )
Thanks JB! Dan helped me to try a couple of more things but no luck..
FYI:  This completely breaks building within Eclipse, not sure what can be done to fix it yet.
R: @chamikaramj PTAL
@kennknowles : please review as this somewhat redoes the work you did
Thanks for noticing this and for the workaround in #1265.
Can you factor the commits into the bullets that you have outlined? It is pretty easy with `git reset HEAD~1` followed by use of `git add -p` for the bits and pieces.

I can answer that there's not a great way to remove the methods of `PCollectionView` yet. We've had some discussion about moving the `ViewFn` to the point of side input, at which point we don't need `PCollectionView` at all. The architecture was ratified (by lazy consensus) a while ago, but the Java API has not been subject to a proper bikeshed.

You are going to hit some problems with the integration tests due to moving things to runners-core. You are going have two options:
- Build a worker image from the changes before you'll get integration tests to pass.
- Duplicate the code in `runners-core` and deprecate the SDK's version. This requires more code import round trips, though, and loses history, so it is not that great an alternative.

But anyhow I really like what you did and actually if you hadn't shown me the bullet points I would have said this LGTM as one commit :-)

To limit your pain and get some of this in immediately, I suggest this series:
- Introduce `ValueInSingleWindow` and use it
- Remove deprecated `AggregatorFactory`

Separate PR:
- Move things to `runners-core` and adjust accordingly

Please merge and add the comments as you understand the need for those flags better than I.  I was just trying to get the effective pom for java7 equivalent to what you had and always use those flags for Java8.
OK. Waiting for the Travis test matrix, as variation in JDKs is key here.
Maybe less fancy empty `PCollections` or comments about why?
(all tests now run and passing)
LGTM, merged after filing https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-887
R: @charlesccychen
Thanks! LGTM.

Thanks.

R: @robertwb for review and merge.
R: @chamikaramj PTAL

@kennknowles this PR adds the end-to-end verification for the word count and fixes two issues that were discovered as part of it:
1. GBK had initial watermark set to 0, hence it wasn't emitting the correct count.
2. View.AsIterable did not emit the expected iterable - BEAM-783

I will add the README file once you have reviewed these changes.

I don't know if there's any way to meaningfully test this, as it's a test of the fact that no call is made to any object after a call to a specific object.

Additionally, this is masked by the mutex on keyed PCollections (which are the only ones currently capable of accessing state), where the mutex is not released until after the changed method completes.
Thanks, LGTM, after that extra large integer test.
@robertwb can you merge this please? This should fix the broken build on Windows.

R: @francesperry love to get your thoughts on these. Feel free to directly reword things.

R: @kennknowles 

This is a cleanup PR with the goal of easing background watermark updates (to allow multiple distinct deliveries for the same `AppliedPTransform` or key).
Yup, Travis is happy. That Jenkins error is so opaque there's nothing to be done. I'll merge.

This seems much more friendly (and less code!).

Spark already does it's [due-diligence](https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/branch-1.6/streaming/src/main/scala/org/apache/spark/streaming/StreamingContext.scala#L231) on the provided checkpoint dir so no need to double verify.
Still warn if prefix does not much a reliable storage.
Jenkins failed on Dataflow IT test, unrelated.

I was thinking that I'd tackle the translator separately, after closing the (still open) question of propagating property names through NVPs, and use the custom IO flavors in the interim.
R: @peihe
Pei is churning on IOCF API so he should look at this.

Sounds good. Note, though, that this CL doesn't change IOChannelFactory APIs - it touches FileIOChannelFactory, but only makes one error message more detailed. All the changes are in FileBasedSink per se and its private classes.

@tgroh @kennknowles refactored following https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/1203

Max, I'm surely missing something. The temp location as a concept should be entirely internal to the FileBasedSink; the user, runner, and tests should only be checking the _final_ name of the files.

Why does this code use the temp location at all?
